item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 12, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Embeddings Are Underrated (98 points | 23 comments)
2. A community-led fork of Organic Maps (185 points | 117 comments)
3. University of Texas-led team solves a big problem for fusion energy (126 points | 65 comments)

8. OpenEoX to Standardize End-of-Life (EOL) and End-of-Support (EOS) Information (10 points | 1 comment)

10. Demonstrably Secure Software Supply Chains with Nix (11 points | discuss)
11. Spade Hardware Description Language (64 points | 28 comments)
12. The FTC puts off enforcing its 'click-to-cancel' rule (149 points | 71 comments)
13. Plain Vanilla Web (1328 points | 609 comments)
14. Show HN: CLI that spots fake GitHub stars, risky dependencies and licence traps (35 points | 14 comments)
15. Spark AI (YC W24) Is Hiring a Full Stack Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)

19. Ash (Almquist Shell) Variants (51 points | 2 comments)
20. A Typical Workday at a Japanese Hardware Tool Store [video] (68 points | 13 comments)
21. Continuous glucose monitors reveal variable glucose responses to the same meals (57 points | 34 comments)
22. US Copyright Office found AI companies breach copyright. Its boss was fired (329 points | 188 comments)
23. Gig Companies Violate Workers Rights (99 points | 46 comments)
24. Continuous Thought Machines (254 points | 25 comments)
25. Intellect-2 Release: The First 32B Model Trained Through Globally Distributed RL (181 points | 58 comments)
26. Implicit UVs: Real-time semi-global parameterization of implicit surfaces [pdf] (28 points | 4 comments)
27. CrowdStrike CEO cuts his voting power by 92% with unexplained gifts (90 points | 39 comments)
28. Armbian Updates: OMV support, boot improvents, Rockchip optimizations (54 points | 12 comments)
29. Making PyPI's test suite faster (110 points | 32 comments)
30. Why Bell Labs Worked (289 points | 197 comments)
